subject: p17838301
History: -year-old male with altered mental status and history of pneumonia.
Findings: The patients chin obscures visualization of the lung apices. Stable linear opacification in the left mid lung likely represents atelectasis or scarring. Calcified bilateral pleural plaques are again seen. No new focal consolidation, pleural effusion, pneumothorax, or pulmonary edema is detected. Cardiomegaly persists. The aorta is tortuous with calcification.
Impression: Stable cardiomegaly without radiographic evidence for acute change.
